task.title: Transferring files from a pod to a Linux shell

step.cmd: Get the name of the pod.
step.info: Pod name have hashes in it that change each time a pod is started. To get the name of the current pods, issue the command: kubectl get pods

step.cmd: To copy a file from the pod, use the syntax below, and make the following substitutions:

plentry.pd: The file name inside the pod.
The path on the machine running kubectl.
The name of the container. If the pod only has one container you can omit this parameter. See for container names.

step.info:
For example if:
The pod name is jitsi-7b86fc4f64-vtrrb
The container name is jigasi
The file name inside the pod is test1.pcap To save this file to the /tmp directory on the machine running kubectl, then the command is:kubectl cp jitsi-7b86fc4f64-vtrrb:/test1.pcap /tmp/test1.pcap --container=jigasi
